org.unc.lac.baboon.subscription

Class ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unc.lac.baboon.subscription.AbstractActionControllerSubscription
      • org.unc.lac.baboon.subscription.AbstractTaskControllerSubscription
        • org.unc.lac.baboon.subscription.ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription

  • public class ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription
extends AbstractTaskControllerSubscription
    A ComplexSecuentialTaskSubscription is a list of TaskActionController objects subscribed to a topic.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ariel Ivan Rabinovich, Juan Jose Arce Giacobbe
    See Also:
    AbstractTaskControllerSubscription

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription

        public ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription(Topic topic)
                                            throws NotSubscribableException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to which TaskActionController objects will be subscribed
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • When the topic is null
        • If there are guard callbacks on the topic and Topic.setGuardCallback and Topic.permission sizes are different.
        • If Topic.permission is null.
        • If Topic.permission is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        public void addTask(TaskActionController taskController)
             throws NotSubscribableException
        This method appends the given TaskActionController to the end of AbstractActionControllerSubscription.actionsList
        Parameters:
        taskController - TaskActionController object to be appended to AbstractActionControllerSubscription.actionsList. The permission and guard callback corresponding to this TaskActionController are determined by the order (or index).
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • If the TaskActionController object does not have a GuardProvider annotated method to handle a guard declared in the topic
        • If the Topic object have less permissions than the number of TaskActionController objects in AbstractActionControllerSubscription.actionsList
        • If the topic permission corresponding to this taskController is empty
        • If the topic permission corresponding to this taskController is null
        • If fails to append the TaskActionController to AbstractActionControllerSubscription.actionsList.
        See Also:
        Topic
